rooms.Name: The Abyss
rooms.Description:
A bleak landscape stretches out before you, utterly featureless. The ground
beneath your feet is hard packed dull orange sand. The sky glows a pale pink
from some source beyond the horizon which you can never reach. You see no one
and hear nothing, and an intense feeling of emptiness is driving you closer
and closer to insanity.

rooms.Name: The Abyss
rooms.Description:
A bleak landscape stretches out before you, utterly featureless. The ground
beneath your feet is hard packed dull orange sand. The sky glows a pale pink
from some source beyond the horizon which you can never reach. You see no one
and hear nothing, and an intense feeling of emptiness is driving you closer
and closer to insanity.

and closer to insanity.

rooms.Name: The Abyss
rooms.Description:
A bleak landscape stretches out before you, utterly featureless. The ground
beneath your feet is hard packed dull orange sand. The sky glows a pale pink
from some source beyond the horizon which you can never reach. You see no one
and hear nothing, and an intense feeling of emptiness is driving you closer
and closer to insanity.

rooms.Name: Outside a Sealed Room
rooms.Description:
The tower's spiraling staircase ends here before a locked wooden door. If
it were what it appeared you could probably just break it down or at least
pick the lock, but you're pretty sure there's more to it since this is a
mage's tower. More important than the door is the pair of glowing eyes
staring at you as if to pierce your soul, moving closer and closer.

Exits.Description:
This appears to be nothing more than an average wooden door with a simple
lock, but you know better than to trust appearances when it comes to mages.

rooms.Name: A Kender Home
rooms.Description:
This is a meager residence. There are a few cots on the left wall, with large
piles of junk thrown under them. On the right wall is a fireplace over which
hangs a cooking pot. A window on the far wall looks out onto the plains around
the city.

rooms.Name: Main Street Kendermore
rooms.Description:
Kender scurry about all around you, looking in each other's pouches for goods
as calmly as they look at the merchants tables. Most of the kender are
chattering about what treasures they have found and the adventures they have
been on. Several run up to you and begin asking about your adventures and
inspecting you items. If you wish to hang onto them, you definitely don't want
to be here.

rooms.Name: A Kender Home
rooms.Description:
As you enter this house the smell of fresh baked bread wafts into your
nostrils. On the far wall are loaves of bread cooling on a table. In side room
are several beds, and covering the walls are shelves full of nick knacks.

rooms.Name: A Kender Home
rooms.Description:
This is a larger house than most. It is two stories, with bedrooms upstairs,
and a kitchen, bathroom, and common room downstairs. By the number of bedrooms
and large collections of stuff, a very large family must live here.

rooms.Name: Main Street Kendermore
rooms.Description:
Kender scurry about all around you, looking in each other's pouches for goods
as calmly as they look at the merchants tables. Most of the kender are
chattering about what treasures they have found and the adventures they have
been on. Several run up to you and begin asking about your adventures and
inspecting you items. If you wish to hang onto them, you definitely don't want
to be here.

rooms.Name: A Path Into Kendermore
rooms.Description:
This path leads directly into the heart of Kendermore. If you are traveling
it you must be either insane or running out of town before what few items you
have left are stolen.

rooms.Name: A Kender Home
rooms.Description:
As you enter this house you hear the sounds of a baby's cry and a mothers
soothing voice. In one corner a mother sits, rocking her baby to sleep, while
a father tends to another child in a crib, and a third child crawls around on
the floor, picking up little "treasures" he finds and looking at them happily.

rooms.Name: Main Street Kendermore
rooms.Description:
Kender scurry about all around you, looking in each other's pouches for goods
as calmly as they look at the merchants tables. Most of the kender are
chattering about what treasures they have found and the adventures they have
been on. Several run up to you and begin asking about your adventures and
inspecting you items. If you wish to hang onto them, you definitely don't want
to be here.

rooms.Name: A Kender Home
rooms.Description:
This is a small house, with one main room, a bathroom, and a closet. Beds are
bunked two high on one wall, and a fireplace for heating and cooking takes up
another wall. The closet door is open and a pile of stuff is spilling out of
it onto the floor.

rooms.Name: The Entrance to Dargaard Keep
rooms.Description:
The outside of the keep is littered with rock from crumbled blocks that
have fallen from the top, and is overgrown with weeds. Above the windows
are black streaks of soot. One gate hangs off it's hinges at the front
wall, while the other is missing, and where the door to the keep used to be
is a layer of ash.

rooms.Name: A Charred Hallway
rooms.Description:
Soot coats the ground, walls and ceiling. The air has a smoky smell to
it, but mostly clear. The soot is like hard packed ground, and you leave
only light tracks as you pass. The fire must have happened a long time ago.
From here, what was probably once the main hallway continues north, while a
smaller hallway leads east.

rooms.Name: A Charred Hallway
rooms.Description:
There is a little less soot here than in the main hallway, and on the
wall hangs the burnt, but still intact remains of a tapestry, however it's
image is no longer discernible. The fire may have spared this part of the
keep some of it's wrath, but time has made up for that. Just ahead the
north wall has collapsed, closing off the passage.

rooms.Name: A Charred Hallway
rooms.Description:
Suits of armor are set up in this part of the hallway. The seals on the
front are still visible, depicting the rose, the sword, and the crown, the
symbols of the Knights of Solamnia. But now the armor is pitch black and
the seals are dull and smudged. They give this gloomy place an even eerier
look. The hallway continues north, and east of here bare hinges hang in the
entrance to a room, the door having burned away.

rooms.Name: A Gutted Bedroom
rooms.Description:
There is a pile of ash on the north wall, probably once a desk or
dresser. The south wall and the southern part of the east wall, as well as
the ceiling above that area have collapsed into a huge mound of rubble. On
the east wall at the base of the rubble is a grim sight, the metal frame of
a bed rests there, and tangled among the springs are the bones of it's
unfortunate occupant.

rooms.Name: A Charred Hallway
rooms.Description:
The main hallway ends here where it meets a cross hallway, but the west
passage is blocked by collapsed walls. North is an arched entryway partly
blocked by the rubble but still passable. After wandering around this place
for a while the soot coating everything is also coating you, and getting
extremely annoying.

rooms.Name: A Charred Hallway
rooms.Description:
The hallway ends here and a doorway opens on a room to the north. Long
hinges like those that would support large double doors stick out like
black fangs into the doorway. Above the door hangs what was probably once a
shield, but it is deformed and stretched from melting slightly in the heat
of the fire.

rooms.Name: A Large Blackened Room
rooms.Description:
A large area in the center of this room is covered in several inches of
ash. The walls and ceiling of the room are pitch black everywhere. The huge
stone blocks that make up the floor as well as the foundation of the keep
have gaping cracks from the intense heat. And arched entryway leads north
out of the room, but some of the stone from the top of the arch seems to
have actually burned away.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Description:

The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean

but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Description:

The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
There is a lot of turbulence here, but it's not because of normal ocean
waves. Instead of mist and fog, there is steam all around you. When you
look down you see the ocean boiling below you! A few meters away the water
is parting, revealing a red glow from far below. You better get out of
here FAST!

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: A Vast Ocean
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows from the north and large waves crash all around you.
The sky is gray and hazy and storm clouds gather in the distance. The ocean
hurls you about as you try to maneuver, protecting it's secrets from all
but the heartiest of adventurers.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
An apparatus for sharpening weapons is set up in this corner. The floor
is gritty and sparkles slightly with iron shavings. One man sits pedaling
a grinding wheel while another sharpens swords on the stone, a pile of
completed swords on his left and a much larger pile of swords that need
sharpening on his right.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
This is a fairly open part of the tower. Not many knights walk through
here and there isn't anything of interest to look at. The few who do walk
by look at you strangely, wondering if you should be here and if they
should do anything about it.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
Stocks are set up in this corner of the tower, facing the entrance. They
are meant to punish and humiliate those who break the strict code of honor
the knights keep. One poor soul is in the stocks, a look of grief and
sorrow on his face. The knights passing by take a quick glance at him and
then pointedly ignore him.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
There is a large stairway here leading up to the next floor of the
tower. It is is lined by a red carpet and has a decorative silver railing.
Knights are coming and going from the stairway, with serious looks on
their faces. It's quite busy here and once again you find yourself being
bumped around and generally ignored.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
A large stone pillar extends from the floor to the ceiling here in the
center of the tower. Baskets are stacked nearby and a piece of paper
affixed to the pillar. As the knights walk near they stop and glance at the
paper and then move on.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Next Shift's Duty Roster
------------------------

Front Gate  -Keldor and Draknor
East Wall   -Torav
North Wall  -Dulron
South Wall  -Algeron
West Wall   -Gorak

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
You stand just inside the the tower on a worn stone floor. Knights are
running here and there moving supplies and going to and from their posts,
and generally using this entrance a lot, tending to bump into you, and
asking very politely that you please MOVE OUT OF THE WAY.

rooms.Name: The Entrance to the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
Eight inch thick, iron bound, wooden doors provide the first line of
defense at the front of the curtain wall, followed by a portcullis, with
murder holes in the walls in between the two for archers to pick off
invaders who have gotten through the first barrier while they struggle with
the second. Finally a metal door protects the entrance to the tower itself.
But these are only necessary during an attack, and currently stand open, as
they have for a long time.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Cleris Tower
rooms.Description:
This corner is wide open, with no obstructions on the floor, and the
knights moving about the tower going around this area. Stone floor is warn
and scared and the walls are marked as well. The reason is soon apparent,
as two knights enter the area and begin sparring.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
A red tapestry with a platinum dragon embroidered on it with platinum
thread hangs on the north wall. All of the knights that pass by here turn
toward it and bow their heads briefly in respect to their god.

rooms.Name: Inside the High Clerist Tower
rooms.Description:
There is little activity here in the corner of the tower. A row of
shields hangs on the wall. They are just simple wooden shields, and look
to be hung there for easy access should someone attack instead of for
decoration.

rooms.Name: On the Curtain Wall
rooms.Description:
You are standing on top of the ten foot thick, thirty foot high stone
wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing
perfect cover as well as range of aim for archers manning the wall.

rooms.Name: On the Curtain Wall
rooms.Description:
You are standing on top of the ten foot thick, thirty foot high stone
wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing
perfect cover as well as range of aim for archers manning the wall.

rooms.Description:
You are standing on top of the ten foot thick, thirty foot high stone
wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing
perfect cover as well as range of aim for archers manning the wall.

rooms.Description:

wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing

rooms.Description:

wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing
perfect cover as well as range of aim for archers manning the wall.

rooms.Name: On the Curtain Wall
rooms.Description:
You are standing on top of the ten foot thick, thirty foot high stone
wall that surrounds the tower, providing the first line of defense. The
outward edge of the wall is raised two feet higher than the rest of the
wall, and there are six foot high sections at regular intervals providing
perfect cover as well as range of aim for archers manning the wall.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
The mouth of this cave is very wide and the cave gets so wide inside
that you cannot see the sides in the meager light. The ceiling is
disproportionately low, only about twenty feet high. The air is very dry,
and from the back comes a noise as of air blowing through jagged rocks.

rooms.Name: A Rocky Coast
rooms.Description:
You stand on the shore of an island that looks more like an enormous
pile of rocks than a normal island. Mountains completely cover it, with
cliffs everywhere but this small beach. Boulders litter the sand and
large, jagged rocks jut out of it. The beach only heads inland twenty feet
before the ground is all rock and climbs steeply into the mountains. To
either side of the beach are cliffs dotted with caves, only the lowermost
of which you can reach. Hidden behind one of the largest rocks you find
another cave, sloping downward into the island.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
Some of the sand from the beach covers the floor of this cave. Sunlight
shines through the entrance quite well, glinting off a pile of gold and
silver coins. The cave curves as you move inward so that the back is in
darkness. From the darkness comes the jingling of shifting coins.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
This cave is very large, with a thirty foot diameter entrance which
opens up so wide that no light reaches the walls or ceiling. From
somewhere way in the back you can hear the slow breathing of powerful
lungs, and every once in a while you catch a yellow glint reflected back
from your light.

rooms.Name: A Boulder Filled Valley
rooms.Description:
Hidden near the center of the island is a small valley. It is covered by
a cliff that hangs over most of it and there are so many boulders filling
it that most of the ground cannot be seen. There is a partially blocked
entrance to a cave sloping steeply downward at your feet, and you can see
many caves in the mountains surrounding the valley.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
A narrow slit opens into a cave the grows wider and wider as you walk
into it. A thin ray of sunlight shines in through a hole in the ceiling of
the cave a hundred feet up, and glints off something silvery near the back
of the cave.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
When you enter this cave you are instantly assailed by a very foul smell
that hurts your lungs. The stone of the cave is pitted as if it has been
eaten away at. Looking toward the back of the cave you see utter darkness,
but the darkness seems to move.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
A small entrance opens up to a large cave that seems to be basically
round. Hundreds of feet up the cave opens to the daylight, but it is too
far off to light the lower portion of the cave. The air seems to be filled
with energy and smells of ozone.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
This cave is a lot like a tunnel, with a wide mouth, and walls about the
same width extending back into darkness. It is very damp in here. Moss
grows in patches on the walls, and the air is musty and humid. Something
in the air makes your eyes water and gives you a choking sensation as you
breathe it.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
The entrance to this cave is about thirty feet wide. It is certainly not
hard to spot once you've moved up on the beach but from the shore there is
a huge rock blocking it from view. Sand dunes roll down into the cave and
make it hard to maneuver. Not enough light can enter to illuminate the
cave because of the huge rock in the way, and after a few steps it is
pitch black.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
This cave slopes slightly upward. It is higher up than the other caves
around here, but not nearly high enough to account for the chill air. It
seems to be coming in waves from the back of the cave. The floor has a
thin layer of frost which makes walking up the slope of the cave even
harder.

rooms.Name: A Dark Cave
rooms.Description:
As you enter this cave you notice it is quite a bit warmer here. As you
move farther in the heat becomes almost unbearable. Near the back of the
cave you can see glinting yellow-red light, like fire reflecting off gold.

rooms.Name: Before the Gates of Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
A large stone keep is built right near the shore of this small island.
Large, iron, double doors provide the only entrance that you can see.
There are guards all along the walls, at the doors, and on top of towers
at each of the corners of the keep.

Exits.Description: Large, iron, double doors, as strong as the massive walls they seal up.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
The knights avoid this area of the tower. Runes cover the walls, and a
few creep onto the floor near the walls. Some of the robed people enter
this area and begin speaking strange words like 'yufzbarr' and 'xafe ay
oculoahp'. Standing in this area you get a strange, repressing feeling.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Knights in dark armor march here and there, throwing you wary glances,
but never taking their attention off their duties. Other people in robes
move swiftly and smoothly around the keep, equally attentive to their
duties.

Exits.Description: Large, iron, double doors, as strong as the massive walls they seal up.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Weapon racks line both walls in this part of the keep. Dozens of swords,
lances, daggers, and axes, all marked with symbols of Takhisis rest here,
sharpened and ready for war. Several knights are guarding the weapons. One
of them is sharpening his sword in what must be an obsessive habit, as the
iron shavings are visible on the ground beneath him and his sword is
thinner than it should be.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Here the runes twist around the floor and up the walls, and join at the
ceiling. They form a repeating pattern in a line on the ceiling that
glows, lighting up the room. A stairway spirals up, and the runes follow
along the ceiling as far as you can see.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Runes twist around on the floor here, forming spiraling pattern. At the
center of the spiral is one large, intricate rune. The few knights who
pass through here walk a wide path around the large rune. A lightheaded
feeling grows stronger and stronger as you stand here.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
This part of the keep is set up as a training area. A circle drawn on
the stone floor marks the boundaries for practice duals. Several torn and
battered dummies are set up near the circle for new knights just learning
how to fight with their weapons. A small weapons rack holds dull swords
and padded clubs and spears to practice with.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Two armed and armored guards stand before a landing to the east. Knights
pass by without any trouble. They watch you and the robed ones carefully,
but do not interfere at all.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
Here is a spacious landing before a wide set of stairs, with room enough
for three men in full armor and carrying weapons to pass. Torches mounted
on the wall provide light, and reveal marring in the stone floor from the
frequent passing of armored troops and bored men with weapons. Someone is
scrubbing at the wall with an iron brush, trying to remove an "I love
Takhisis" carving made by an over zealous soldier.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
As you draw near this part of the tower, an odd feeling comes over you,
almost as if there is a small force push at you from all sides. The walls
here are covered with runes. Some of the knights glance over at this place
and then quickly turn away, and avoid walking near it. The robed people
walk near and through this area without any worry.

rooms.Name: Inside Storm's Keep
rooms.Description:
There is a table wedged into the corner here. Maps of different parts of
the world cover the table and the walls above it. Troops are marked with
tacks, black for the Knights of Takhisis, and various colors for all their
foes. Unfortunately, or fortunately, depending on your side, the black
tacks far outnumber the others. Lines are drawn all over the map, showing
movements and strategies, and it appears that soon a very swift and well
planned attack will begin.

rooms.Name: Waywreth Forest
rooms.Description:
This forest has a very unnerving quality about it. The trees are all
twisted, casting shadows with a vaguely human appearance in places where
light gets through, and seeming alive themselves in the darkness. The way
you want to go always seems blocked, and when you look down an open path
and look away, it too is blocked when you look back. The normal noises of
creaking branches and forest animals sound strange and distorted, at times
mocking, and other times malicious.

rooms.Name: Raistlin's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
This place has been locked tight and guarded by undead under the command of
Raistlin loyal even after his death. No mortal was ever to enter this place
again, and your presence here can only mean that something is very wrong.
There is a large table in the center of the room covered with scrolls, flasks
filled colorful liquids, and jars full of all manner of putrid substances.
Filling several bookshelves along the wall are two collections of books, one
bound in deep blue and the other bound in black, containing nothing less than
the most powerful magical research ever attempted. The most outstanding
feature of this room, and the reason it has been sealed, is the large oval
portal pushed up against the north wall. Five dragon heads surround it, and
would devour anyone who tried to pass, but now, without explanation, the heads
are silent and motionless and the normally swirling portal is completely calm
as if it were simply a window looking out on the Abyss.

Exits.Description:
This appears to be nothing more than an average wooden door with a simple lock,
but you know better than to trust appearances when it comes to mages.
